thread.title: For The First Time In 6275 Days, Virat Kohli Achieves EMBARRASSING Milestone
thread.title_full: For The First Time In 6275 Days, Virat Kohli Achieves EMBARRASSING Milestone

author: @TIMESNOW
title: For The First Time In 6275 Days, Virat Kohli Achieves EMBARRASSING Milestone
text:
Cricket
For The First Time In 6275 Days, Virat Kohli Achieves EMBARRASSING Milestone
In the second ODI against Australia at the Adelaide Oval, Virat Kohli disappointed again, scoring yet another duck, this time from 4 deliveries. he thus marked a historic low for the first time in 6275 days.
For The First Time In 6275 Days, Virat Kohli Achieves EMBARRASSING Milestone
Photo : AP
India are currently taking on Australia in the second ODI of the three-match series at the Adelaide Oval. This is a must-win game for India, as a loss here would mean that they would lose the series with a match to go. All eyes were on Virat Kohli, especially after he scored a duck in the first ODI, which was his return to international cricket after seven months. However, he massively disappointed in Adelaide as well, which he once described as his favourite ground in Australia. In process, Kohli managed to achieve an embarrassing feat for the first time in 6275 days.
Virat Kohli got out in the seventh over of the 2nd ODI, as a delivery from Xavier Bartlett zipped in and caught him in his pads right in front of the stumps. He thus got out LBW for a duck in four deliveries. This was his second consecutive duck in the series.
For the first time since he made his debut for Team India back in August 18, 2008, against Sri Lanka in an ODI match, Virat Kohli has got out for two consecutive ducks. He has never managed to achieve this embarrassing feat before today in international cricket.
This is also the first time that Virat Kohli has scored two ducks in a single ODI series. For context, the series against Australia is the 75th ODI series that Kohli is playing in his storied career.
Rohit Sharma Creates History
While Virat Kohli got out for a duck, Rohit Sharma managed to create history in the second ODI vs Australia
When Rohit Sharma hit his first boundary of the series in his 2nd ODI, he became the first Indian batter in history to score 1000 runs against Australia in Australia. He has scored four fifties and two hundreds against Australia Down Under as well.
Shaunak Ghosh author
